title: clai Phase 1 Implementation
description:
Implement the complete clai Phase 1 architecture as specified in tech_design.md:
- Shell Integration (zsh, bash, PowerShell hooks)
- Thin Client Binary (clai-shim) for fire-and-forget shell communication
- User-mode Daemon (clai-daemon) as central brain
- SQLite storage with WAL mode
- Provider adapters for AI (Anthropic, OpenAI, Google)
- Suggestion ranking engine
- gRPC/Protobuf IPC layer

This follows the 7-stream parallel implementation plan from the tech spec (Sections 15-18).
close_reason: All 7 implementation streams completed. Full Phase 1 architecture implemented: gRPC/Protobuf IPC, SQLite storage, clai-shim, clai-daemon, CLI commands, shell hooks (zsh/bash), provider adapters (Anthropic/OpenAI/Google), ranking engine, and integration tests (26 passing). Ready for documentation and deployment.

title: go.mod: review grpc v1.78.0 breaking change

Ensure CI/dev environments test against these versions and verify no existing client URLs break under the new grpc validation rules. Also modernc.org/sqlite v1.44.3 was very recently released.

title: commands.go: change IsSuccess to pointer type for tri-state
description: In internal/storage/commands.go around line 46-50: Change the Command.IsSuccess field to a pointer type (*bool) so it can be tri-state (nil = unknown), then in the CreateCommand logic treat nil as success: initialize isSuccess := 1 and only set isSuccess = 0 when cmd.IsSuccess != nil && !*cmd.IsSuccess. Update any call sites to pass a pointer when they explicitly know success/failure. This makes unset/unknown exit state default to success.

title: commands.go: deduplicate NormalizeCommand/HashCommand/isNumeric
description: The functions NormalizeCommand, HashCommand, and isNumeric are duplicated in internal/storage/commands.go and internal/suggest/normalize.go. To improve maintainability and avoid code duplication, these helper functions should be defined in a single location (e.g., the suggest package) and imported where needed. The storage package could then call suggest.Normalize() and suggest.Hash().

title: Command suggestion while typing (history matching)
description:
Show command suggestions as user types, matching against command history.

**Inspiration:** Fish shell's autosuggestions, zsh-autosuggestions plugin

**Technical approach:**
1. ZLE widget hooked to every keystroke (zle -N self-insert)
2. Parse shell history file (~/.zsh_history, ~/.bash_history)
3. Fuzzy match current BUFFER against history
4. Display suggestion in dim text after cursor (POSTDISPLAY in Zsh)
5. Tab or right-arrow to accept

**Complexity:** High - requires efficient history indexing, per-keystroke performance

**Files:**
- internal/cmd/shell/zsh/clai.zsh - ZLE hooks
- internal/cmd/shell/bash/clai.bash - readline integration
- internal/cmd/shell/fish/clai.fish - Fish already has this, may just enable

**Research needed:**
- Performance impact of history search on every keystroke
- How zsh-autosuggestions handles large history files
- Whether to cache/index history
close_reason: Implemented inline history suggestions using POSTDISPLAY. Right-arrow to accept.

title: Buffer concatenation after history recall with Up arrow
description:
When recalling a command using Up arrow and then typing new text, the new text is concatenated to the recalled command instead of replacing it or inserting at cursor position.

**Reproduction:**
1. Run a command (e.g., 'echo second')
2. Press Up arrow to recall it into the buffer
3. Type new text (e.g., 'echo third')
4. Buffer shows: 'echo secondecho third' (concatenated)

**Expected:** Either:
- Replace the recalled command entirely, OR
- Insert at cursor position

**Evidence:**
- Screenshot: tests/e2e/screenshots/current/bug2-buffer-concatenation.png
- Discovered via AI-assisted terminal testing POC

**Shell:** bash (needs testing in zsh/fish)
notes:
**Analysis:**

Looking at the bash integration code (internal/cmd/shell/bash/clai.bash), the fallback history apply function (lines 203-209) correctly replaces READLINE_LINE:

```bash
_clai_fallback_apply() {
    local selected="${_CLAI_FALLBACK_ITEMS[$_CLAI_FALLBACK_INDEX]}"
    if [[ -n "$selected" ]]; then
        READLINE_LINE="$selected"
        READLINE_POINT=${#READLINE_LINE}
    fi
}
```

This suggests the concatenation might be caused by how Playwright's `pressSequentially` interacts with the gotty web terminal, not a clai bug.

**To verify:** Need to test in a real terminal (not via Playwright/gotty):
1. Open bash terminal
2. Type 'echo first', press Enter
3. Type 'echo second', press Enter  
4. Press Up arrow (should show 'echo second')
5. Type 'echo third' - does it concatenate or replace?

If it concatenates in real terminal = clai bug
If it works correctly in real terminal = Playwright/gotty interaction issue
close_reason: Not a bug - this is expected shell behavior. When Up arrow recalls a command, the cursor is positioned at the end. Typing appends at cursor position, so 'echo second' + typing 'echo third' = 'echo secondecho third'. This is standard readline/bash behavior, not a clai issue.

title: Per-tab command history
description:
Maintain separate command history per terminal tab/session, so arrow-up shows commands from current context.

**Problem:** Global history mixes commands from different projects/contexts

**Technical approach:**
1. Detect terminal tab/session identifier:
   - $TERM_SESSION_ID (iTerm2)
   - $KITTY_WINDOW_ID (Kitty)
   - $GHOSTTY_RESOURCES_DIR + PID (Ghostty)
   - $TMUX_PANE (tmux)
   - Fallback: TTY device (/dev/ttys001)
2. Store history in per-session files: ~/.cache/clai/history/<session-id>
3. Merge with global history on session end (optional)

**Complexity:** Medium - mostly configuration and file management

**Challenges:**
- Different terminal emulators use different env vars
- Session ID persistence across shell restarts
- History file cleanup for old sessions

**Files:**
- internal/cmd/shell/zsh/clai.zsh - HISTFILE override
- internal/cmd/shell/bash/clai.bash - HISTFILE override  
- internal/cmd/shell/fish/clai.fish - fish_history variable
- New: internal/cmd/history.go - Session detection logic

title: google.go: fix data race in Available() cliPath mutation

Fix by making initialization thread-safe: add a sync.Once field (e.g., cliOnce) or a mutex to the GoogleProvider struct and move the CLI discovery logic currently in Available() into a once.Do closure (or protected critical section) that sets cliPath (and an optional cached availability flag), then have Available() call cliOnce.Do(...) and read the cached values instead of writing cliPath on every call.

title: Session not registered with daemon on shell startup
description:
When a new shell session starts, clai displays a session ID in the status header (e.g., [3dce2552]), but running 'clai history' fails with 'session not found'. The session ID shown in the error matches the one in the header, confirming the session is generated but not registered with the daemon.

**Reproduction:**
1. Start a new bash shell (tested via gotty web terminal)
2. clai integration loads, shows session ID in header
3. Run 'clai history'
4. Error: session not found (same ID as header)

**Evidence:**
- Screenshot: tests/e2e/screenshots/current/bug1-session-not-found.png
- Discovered via AI-assisted terminal testing POC

**Expected:** Session should be registered with daemon when shell integration loads.
notes:
**Root cause identified:**

The shell init script (internal/cmd/shell/bash/clai.bash) generates a session ID at line 611:
```bash
export CLAI_SESSION_ID="{{CLAI_SESSION_ID}}"
```

And displays it in the startup message at line 789:
```bash
printf '๐ค clai [%s] Tab complete | accept cmd | ?"describe task"' "${CLAI_SESSION_ID:0:8}"
```

BUT there is no call to `clai-shim session-start` to register the session with the daemon.

The shim has the session-start command ready (cmd/clai-shim/main.go lines 153-179):
```go
func runSessionStart() {
    // ... 
    client.SessionStart(sessionID, cwd, info)
}
```

**Fix:** Add a call to clai-shim session-start in the shell init script:
```bash
(clai-shim session-start --session-id="$CLAI_SESSION_ID" --cwd="$PWD" --shell="bash" &)
```
close_reason: Fixed by adding clai-shim session-start call to bash and fish shell init scripts. The zsh script already had this call. Verified fix works via Playwright testing - clai history no longer shows 'session not found' error.

title: Stream G: Suggestion Ranking Engine
description:
**Wave 2 - Depends on Stream B (storage)**

Deliverables:
- internal/suggest/ranker.go - Scoring algorithm
- internal/suggest/sources.go - Session/CWD/Global sources
- internal/suggest/normalize.go - Command normalization

Scoring Formula:
score = (source_weight * 0.4) + (recency_score * 0.3) + (success_score * 0.2) + (affinity_score * 0.1)

Source Weights: session=1.0, cwd=0.7, global=0.4
Recency: 1.0 / (1 + log(hours_since_use + 1))
Success: success_count / (success_count + failure_count)
Affinity: 1.0 if same tool prefix as last command

Acceptance Criteria:
- Implements scoring formula
- Queries all three scopes
- Merges and deduplicates
- < 50ms latency for 10K history
- 85% test coverage

title: Add shell-friendly suggestion/history APIs and toggles
description:
Description:
- Provide shell-friendly outputs for suggestions and history (plain lines; optional JSON).
- Add scope selection for history (session/cwd/global) and prefix filtering for picker use.
- Add `clai on`/`clai off` plus `CLAI_OFF=1` handling that shell scripts can read.

Acceptance:
- `clai suggest` supports multi-result output with a fast, no-frills format and optional metadata.
- `clai history` can output raw command lists with explicit scope selection and prefix filtering.
- `clai on`/`clai off` toggles suggestion UX in current session; `CLAI_OFF=1` disables without breaking shell usage.

title: bug(zsh): backspace then right-arrow accepts stale remainder
description:
Repro:
- In zsh with ghost suggestion visible, backspace within buffer.
- Press Right Arrow to accept suggestion.

Actual:
- Right Arrow completes using stale suggestion remainder; trailing characters (e.g., 'rc') remain ghosted/light gray and are appended incorrectly.
  Example: intended 'source ~/.zshrc' becomes 'source ~/.zshrcrc'.

Expected:
- Suggestion updates/clears after backspace; Right Arrow accepts current suggestion only.

Notes:
- Likely stale suggestion not refreshed or accept logic not validating against current buffer.
close_reason: Fixed in c0ac523: _ai_forward_char now validates _AI_CURRENT_SUGGESTION is a prefix of BUFFER before accepting. Stale suggestions after backspace are rejected. Test added.

title: zsh menu UX: reverse order + paging on up
description:
Goal:
Implement requested zsh auto-completion menu UX.

Plan:
1) Order: render list bottom-to-up so line 5 is next suggestion; line 1 is 5th suggestion.
2) Navigation: Down moves downward in list toward first suggestion; when at first suggestion, Down does nothing.
3) Paging: when cursor is at top and Up is pressed, load next page (next 5 items), keep list size constant, and move cursor to bottom.
4) Bounds: when no more items above, Up does nothing (optionally brief 'no more' hint).
5) Update render + state machine to support reversed ordering and paging without stale selections.
6) Add regression checklist for open, paging, bounds, and close-on-edit.

Acceptance:
- Initial menu shows suggestions in reversed order (newest/closest at bottom).
- Down arrow does nothing at first suggestion.
- Up at top paginates; cursor lands at bottom; list updates to next 5.
- No stale items; menu state remains consistent across paging.

title: Zsh fish-like UX integration (ghost text + pickers)
description:
Description:
- Replace right-prompt hint with true inline ghost text via POSTDISPLAY.
- Implement suggestion picker (Tab) and history picker (Up) using ZLE widgets and `zle -M`.
- Add keybindings for accept full/next token, dismiss (Esc), and scope switching (Ctrl+x s/d/g).
- Merge clai suggestions with native completions; suppress zsh-autosuggestions while active.
- Debounce/cancel/stale-result handling to avoid blocking typing.

Acceptance:
- Ghost text visibility matches spec (hidden when buffer empty, cursor not at EOL, picker open, or UI paused).
- Right Arrow accepts full suggestion; Alt+Right accepts next token.
- Tab opens picker with โค5 merged suggestions; Esc restores original buffer.
- Up Arrow opens history picker with scope switching; selection replaces buffer without executing.
- Typing remains responsive; stale suggestions discarded.

title: fix(bash): _clai_disable should remove per-command completions
description: In clai.bash, _clai_disable only runs 'complete -r -D' but on bash <4 completions are registered per-command (git npm yarn docker kubectl make go cargo python pip). Store the command list in _CLAI_COMMANDS when registering and iterate it in _clai_disable to call 'complete -r' for each.

title: fix(fish): preserve autosuggestion state across enable/disable
description: In clai.fish, enabling clai blindly sets fish_autosuggestion_enabled=0 and _clai_disable blindly restores to 1. If user had autosuggestions already disabled, we'd wrongly enable them. Save the prior value in _clai_prev_autosuggestion before disabling, restore it in _clai_disable (fallback to 1 if not set).

title: fix: docker-compose test-docker should abort on container exit
description: Makefile test-docker target (lines 105, 108): docker-compose up can hang if test container exits but other services keep running. Add --abort-on-container-exit or --exit-code-from to both docker-compose and docker compose invocations.

title: fix: improve init_test.go function body extraction
description: Two issues in init_test.go: (1) Widget regex at line 274 uses [^}]+ which stops at first }, missing nested braces. Use a pattern that checks presence without full body extraction. (2) Fixed offsets downStart+400 and upStart+800 at lines 414/424 are fragile. Find the next function boundary instead of using hardcoded offsets.

title: Bash fish-like UX integration (picker-only)
description:
Description:
- Implement suggestion picker on Tab using Readline `COMPREPLY` and `menu-complete` cycling.
- Add history picker on Up Arrow with scope switching (Ctrl+x s/d/g).
- Merge clai suggestions ahead of native completions and dedupe.
- Enforce bounded latency: fallback to native completions if clai is slow/unavailable.
- Honor `CLAI_OFF=1` to disable clai UX in-session.

Acceptance:
- Tab opens picker; repeated Tab cycles suggestions; clai suggestions appear before native completions.
- Up Arrow opens history picker; selection replaces buffer without executing; Esc cancels.
- If clai is slow/unavailable, native completions return immediately.
- Disabling clai restores default Readline behavior.

title: Fish fish-like UX integration (ghost text + pickers)
description:
Description:
- Integrate clai suggestions into fish autosuggestion pipeline for ghost text.
- Implement suggestion picker (Tab) and history picker (Up) with scope switching (Ctrl+x s/d/g).
- Add keybindings for accept full/next token and dismiss (Esc).
- Suppress fish native autosuggestions while clai is active.
- Ensure non-blocking suggestion fetch with debounce/staleness handling.

Acceptance:
- Ghost text appears inline from clai and hides under spec conditions.
- Tab opens picker; Up opens history picker; Esc cancels and restores buffer.
- Scope switching updates history picker results.
- Typing remains responsive and clai can be disabled via `CLAI_OFF=1`.

title: cache.go: remove unbounded goroutine for hit_count update

title: install.go: handle f.Stat() and os.ReadFile errors
description: In internal/cmd/install.go around line 43-134: The code in runInstall ignores errors from f.Stat() and os.ReadFile which can lead to a nil-deref panic when calling info.Size() and hides read failures. Change the block that currently does 'info, _ := f.Stat()' and 'content, _ := os.ReadFile(rcFile)' to check and handle errors: call info, err := f.Stat() and if err \!= nil return a wrapped error, ensure info \!= nil before using info.Size(), and call content, err := os.ReadFile(rcFile) and if err \!= nil return a wrapped error (or skip newline check) before accessing content[len(content)-1]. Update the runInstall function to return descriptive errors for f.Stat and os.ReadFile failures so the subsequent writes (f.WriteString) are safe.

title: Arrow-up history preview (show last N matches)

When pressing arrow-up, show a preview of the last 5 commands matching current input instead of cycling one-by-one.

**Inspiration:** fzf history search, atuin shell history

**Technical approach:**
1. Override up-arrow ZLE widget (up-line-or-history)
2. If BUFFER is non-empty, show dropdown/overlay with matching history
3. Use Zsh's zle -M for message display or POSTDISPLAY
4. Arrow keys navigate, Enter selects
5. Escape cancels

**Complexity:** High - requires overlay/popup UI in terminal

**Challenges:**
- Terminal doesn't have native popup/dropdown support
- Need to handle terminal resize, scrollback
- May need to clear/restore display after selection

**Alternative:** Integrate with fzf if available (fzf --history)

**Files:**
- internal/cmd/shell/zsh/clai.zsh - ZLE widget
- internal/cmd/shell/bash/clai.bash - bind -x for up-arrow
- internal/cmd/shell/fish/clai.fish - bind up for fish

description:
**Wave 2 - Depends on Stream A (proto)**

Deliverables:
- cmd/clai-shim/main.go
- cmd/clai-shim/commands/*.go (root, session, log, suggest, textcmd)
- internal/ipc/client.go - gRPC client wrapper
- internal/ipc/dial.go - Socket connection
- internal/ipc/spawn.go - Daemon spawning

Subcommands: session-start, session-end, log-start, log-end, suggest, text-to-command

Fire-and-Forget Contract:
- Logging: 10ms timeout, ignore errors
- Suggestions: 50ms timeout, return empty on timeout
- Silent failure (exit 0) on all errors

Acceptance Criteria:
- Connects to Unix socket ~/.clai/run/clai.sock
- Spawns daemon if socket missing
- < 10ms startup time
- Fire-and-forget for logging
- 75% test coverage

title: anthropic.go: preallocate suggestions slice

Change its initialization to preallocate capacity for up to 3 entries (e.g., make([]Suggestion, 0, 3)) since the logic caps suggestions at 3 so the capacity is sufficient.

title: sessions_test.go: add t.Parallel() to subtests
description: In internal/storage/sessions_test.go around line 170-181: The table-driven subtests don't call t.Parallel(). For consistency with other tests in this file and to enable parallel subtest execution, add t.Parallel() to each subtest.

title: patterns_test.go: guard against missing pattern names
description: In internal/sanitize/patterns_test.go around line 60-66: If a pattern name changes or is removed, pattern.Regex.MatchString will panic. Add a helper function mustPattern that t.Fatalf when a named pattern is missing to make failures clearer and safer.

title: Assistant Comment E2E Tests (3 tests)
description:
Implement E2E tests for assistant comments:
- Suggestion appears after failed command (exit != 0)
- Comment uses shell-specific syntax (# for bash/zsh)
- Comment appears on new prompt line

Tags: suggestion, comment, failure

title: docs/installation.md: fix table separator spacing
description: In docs/installation.md around line 92-98: The separator row needs padding to satisfy the configured table style (markdownlint MD060).

title: lifecycle.go: fix goroutine leak and add signal.Stop
description: In internal/daemon/lifecycle.go around line 28-45: If server.Start(ctx) returns before a signal is received, the goroutine on line 32 will block forever on sigChan. Additionally, signal.Stop(sigChan) should be called to stop signal delivery when no longer needed. Add a select on ctx.Done() in the signal handler goroutine and call signal.Stop(sigChan) with defer.

title: patterns.go: broaden Bearer token pattern
description: In internal/sanitize/patterns.go around line 62-66: The Bearer token regex requires a 3-part JWT-like structure which misses simpler bearer tokens that don't follow JWT format (e.g., Bearer abc123def456). Consider broadening the pattern or adding a separate pattern for non-JWT bearer tokens.

title: Fix claude-daemon spawns wrong subcommand
description: internal/claude/daemon.go:116 still uses 'daemon run' but command was renamed to 'claude-daemon'. StartDaemonProcess() needs to spawn 'claude-daemon run' instead.
close_reason: Fixed in 51b57e1 - changed spawn from 'daemon run' to 'claude-daemon run'

title: E2E: Test clai suggest output formats
description:
Add e2e tests for `clai suggest` command with different output formats.

**Test scenarios:**
1. Text format (default): `clai suggest` - verify numbered list with reasons
2. JSON format: `clai suggest --format=json` - verify valid JSON structure
3. fzf format: `clai suggest --format=fzf` - verify plain command list
4. Verify suggestion reasons are displayed (repo_trans, global_trans, freq, project_task)
5. Test with --limit flag
6. Test empty suggestions case

**Files:** tests/e2e/example-test-plan.yaml
**Spec ref:** tech_suggestions_v3.md ยง14.2, ยง11.4

title: context.go: trim recentCmds at construction
description: In internal/provider/context.go around line 16-23: Consider trimming recentCmds at construction to enforce MaxRecentCommands. This keeps prompt sizes bounded even if callers forget to call TrimRecentCommands. Update NewContextBuilder to set recentCmds: TrimRecentCommands(recentCmds) instead of recentCmds: recentCmds.

title: config.go: derive directory from path in SaveToFile
description: In internal/config/config.go around line 124-139: Config.SaveToFile ignores the provided path when creating directories by always calling DefaultPaths().EnsureDirectories(). Instead, derive the directory from the passed-in path and ensure that directory exists before writing. Update SaveToFile to compute dir := filepath.Dir(path), call os.MkdirAll(dir, 0755) or use a paths.EnsureDirectories variant targeted at dir, then proceed to yaml.Marshal(c) and os.WriteFile(path, data, 0644) so custom paths with missing parents are created correctly.

description:

- SSH session stable after picker close
- Remote session remains functional

Tags: pty, ssh, injection, critical

title: README.md: add language identifier to code fence

title: Stop swallowing DB errors in import loop
description: internal/storage/import.go:132-147 - Loop swallows all ExecContext errors. Only ignore duplicate-key errors, propagate others.

Implement E2E tests for color detection:

title: config_cmd.go: pass paths to listConfig to avoid redundant call
description: In internal/cmd/config_cmd.go around line 39-59: The paths variable created at line 40 is only used in the setConfig case. For listConfig, config.DefaultPaths() is called again at line 83. Refactor listConfig to accept paths as parameter and update the call to pass paths.

title: cache_test.go: allow small TTL tolerance
description: In internal/storage/cache_test.go around line 179-213: If SetCached assigns CreatedAt/ExpiresAt using separate time.Now() calls, exact equality can be off by a few milliseconds. Add a small tolerance (e.g., 1s) to keep the test stable.

title: patterns.go: return copy from GetSecretPatterns
description: In internal/sanitize/patterns.go around line 74-77: GetSecretPatterns() returns the secretPatterns slice directly, which allows callers to mutate the shared slice. Return a copy if immutability is important, or document that the returned slice should not be modified.

title: config_cmd.go: log warning when key fails to retrieve
description: In internal/cmd/config_cmd.go around line 61-86: Line 70 silently continues when cfg.Get(key) returns an error. While this avoids breaking the listing, it could hide misconfiguration issues. Add a debug log or collect failed keys for a summary to improve debuggability.

title: spawn_test.go: handle UserHomeDir errors in tests
description: In internal/ipc/spawn_test.go around line 9-27: Errors from os.UserHomeDir() are ignored which can make failures misleading on systems without a resolvable home directory. Prefer failing fast with t.Fatalf when UserHomeDir fails.

title: logs.go: prevent panic when n is negative in tailLogs
description: In internal/cmd/logs.go around line 59-80: The tailLogs function can panic when n is negative because make([]string, 0, n) does not accept a negative capacity. Add a defensive validation at the start of tailLogs(filename string, n int) to reject non-positive values (n <= 0) and return a clear error (e.g., 'invalid lines parameter') so callers (and the CLI flag logsLines) cannot pass a negative or zero value.

title: handlers.go: retrieve actual lastCommand for tool affinity
description: In internal/daemon/handlers.go, the lastCommand is currently hardcoded to an empty string, which means the tool affinity scoring in the ranker will not work as intended. To improve suggestion relevance, the actual last command from the session should be retrieved from the database here.

title: doctor.go: fix import of non-existent claude package
description: In internal/cmd/doctor.go, the file imports the non-existent claude package which will cause a compilation error. Change the import to github.com/runger/clai/internal/daemon and update the call to claude.IsDaemonRunning() to daemon.IsRunning().

title: logs.go: fix tail logic line corruption across chunks
description: In internal/cmd/logs.go around line 78-108: The tail logic can corrupt lines spanning read chunks because splitLines(chunk) is called per chunk independently. Fix read loop in the function containing variables offset/readSize/chunkLines by carrying a partial fragment between iterations: keep a string 'remainder' that holds the (incomplete) leading fragment from the previous read, prepend it to the current chunk before calling splitLines, then update 'remainder' to the first element if the chunk did not start on a line boundary (or to the last element if you process chunks backwards), ensuring you stitch partial lines across chunk boundaries and only append complete lines into 'lines'.

title: cache_test.go: replace time.Sleep with polling loop
description: In internal/storage/cache_test.go around line 100-144: Replace the fixed time.Sleep(100 * time.Millisecond) in TestSQLiteStore_GetCached_IncrementsHitCount with a polling loop that queries the DB via store.DB().QueryRowContext (same SELECT hit_count ...) until hitCount >= 3 or a timeout elapses (e.g., 1-2s), sleeping a short interval (e.g., 10-50ms) between polls. Fail the test if the timeout expires. Keep the final assertion that hitCount >= 3.

title: anthropic.go: handle numbered/bulleted lists in fixes loop
description: In internal/provider/anthropic.go around line 254-268: The fixes loop currently only appends when inFixes is true and ignores numbered/bulleted lists. Update the logic around cleanCommandPrefix(line) and the inFixes check so that a cleaned line that matches a numbered/bullet pattern (e.g., starts with '1.', '1)', '-' or '*') is treated as the start of the fixes section: detect that pattern, set inFixes = true, then create the Suggestion and append to fixes so numbered/bulleted commands are not dropped.

Tags: paste, bracketed, raw

title: docs/quickstart.md: add language tags to code blocks
